question: If $\vec{a}, \vec{b}, \vec{c}$ are three non-coplanar vectors and p, q, r are vectors defined by $\vec{p}=\frac{\vec{a}\times\vec{c}}{[\vec{a}\vec{b}\vec{c}]}$ etc... then $(\vec{a}+\vec{b}).\vec{p}+(\vec{b}+\vec{c}).\vec{q}+(\vec{c}+\vec{a}).\vec{r}$ is
explanation: Based on the answer key D (3), the intended definition of p, q, r likely corresponds to the standard reciprocal system where $\vec{a}\cdot\vec{p}=1, \vec{b}\cdot\vec{p}=0$, etc.
In that case, each term in the sum evaluates to 1, totaling 3.
